STATE OF MICHIGAN
DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES
GRETCHEN WHITMER
LANS ING
ELIZABETH HERTEL
GOVERNOR DIRECTOR
March 10, 2025
Kevin Proshwitz
BERRIEN COUNTY DHHS
401 8TH ST,
BENTON HARBOR, MI, 49022-5005
RE: License#: CP110200971
Dear Kevin Proshwitz:
Attached is the Renewal Inspection Report for the above referenced agency completed
on 3/7/2025. Due to the violations of applicable licensing rules, a written corrective action
plan is required. The corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and
must include the following:
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• How compliance with each citation will be achieved.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the action steps in the
corrective action plan.
• Specific time frames for each citation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you fail to submit an acceptable corrective action plan, disciplinary action may result.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact area manager, Jessica VandenHeuvel, at (616)204-6992.
Sincerely,
Holly Austin, Licensing Consultant
P.O. BOX 30650 • LANSING, MICHIGAN 48909
www.michigan.gov • (517) 335-1980

MICHIGAN DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES
DIVISION OF CHILD WELFARE LICENSING
RENEWAL INSPECTION REPORT

BENTON HARBOR, MI 49022-5005

children in foster home, Supervise
Independent Living

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
The facility is in compliance with all applicable licensing statutes and rules except for
the following:
CPA Rule 400.12324 Reevaluation
• (3) An agency shall record the dates and places
of contacts and persons interviewed or observed
as part of a reevaluation.
1 of 6 Open Foster Home files reviewed contained a reevaluation report that did
not specify the licensees placement preference or recommended placement
related to youths' SOGIE.
CPA Rule 400.12324 Reevaluation
• (1) An agency shall conduct an annual on-site
visit and complete a written reevaluation of a
foster home.
2 of 6 Open Foster Home files reviewed contained a reevaluation report
completed less than 15 days before the interim or expiration date.
CPA Rule 400.12326 Borrowed home
• (1) Before placing a child in a foster home
certified by another agency the borrowing

agency shall have a record containing all the
following:
• (f) Documentation that the foster parent
has received orientation to the policies of
the borrowing agency.
1 of 3 Borrowed Bed files reviewed did not contain documentation that the foster
parent received orientation to the policies of the borrowing agency prior to
placement.
CPA Rule 400.12326 Borrowed home
• (1) Before placing a child in a foster home
certified by another agency the borrowing
agency shall have a record containing all the
following:
• (g) A copy of the foster parent /agency
agreement signed by the foster parent
and the borrowing agency.
1 of 3 Borrowed Bed files reviewed did not contain a copy of the foster
parent/agency agreement signed by the foster parent and agency prior to
placement.
CPA Rule 400.12327 Special evaluation
• (4) Before completion of the written report
required by subrule (6) of this rule, an agency
shall provide the foster parent with a verbal
summary of the preliminary findings at the
conclusion of the evaluation.
1 of 6 Open Foster Home files reviewed contained a Special evaluation report
documenting the verbal summary of preliminary findings was provided prior to the
completion of the investigation.
CPA Rule 400.12413 Medical and dental care policy
• (1) An agency's medical and dental care policy
must, include all the following:

• (c) A physical examination for each child
as follows, unless a greater frequency is
medically indicated:
• (i) A comprehensive medical
examination, including a
behavioral/mental health and
trauma screening, within 30
calendar days from the date the
child entered into an out-of-home
placement, regardless of the date
of the last physical examination.
2 of 8 Open files of youth in Foster Care placements did not contain
documentation of the initial medical examination completed within 30 days of out-
of-home placement.
REPEAT VIOLATION ESTABLISHED
Interim 2/16/2024, CAP Approved 3/7/2024
CPA Rule 400.12413 Medical and dental care policy
• (1) An agency's medical and dental care policy
must, include all the following:
• (c) A physical examination for each child
as follows, unless a greater frequency is
medically indicated:
• (ii) A physical examination every
14 months.
1 of 8 Open files of youths in Foster Care placements did not contain
documentation of the periodic medical examination completed timely.
CPA Rule 400.12413 Medical and dental care policy
• (1) An agency's medical and dental care policy
must, include all the following:
• (d) Current immunizations for each child
as required by section 5111 of the public
health code, 1978 PA 368, MCL
333.5111. All the following apply:

• (ii) A copy of a waiver addressed
to the department that is signed by
the parent stating immunizations
are not being administered due to
religious, medical, or other reasons
is sufficient documentation of
immunizations, unless the child is
a temporary court ward, a motion
is heard, and order is entered by
the circuit court for the child's case.
A waiver must be accompanied by
a certification by the local health
department that the parent or
parents received education on the
risks of not receiving the vaccines
being waived and the benefits of
vaccination to the individual and
the community as required by
section 5111 of the public health
code, 1978 PA 368, MCL
333.5111, and R 325.176(12).
1 of 8 Open files of youths in Foster Care placements contained documentation of
the youth's immunizations being overdue.
CPA Rule 400.12418 Development of service plans
• (2) An agency shall complete written service
plans for each child and parent or parents, as
follows:
• (b) Within 120 calendar days after the
initial removal and at least once every 90
calendar days thereafter.
1 of 8 Open files of youths in Foster Care Placements contained one service plan
completed late.
CPA Rule 400.12421 Visitation and family time; in person contact
• (2) An agency social service worker shall visit
the foster child, and the foster parent, if

applicable, in the child's placement at least once
every month.
1 of 8 Open files of youths in Foster Care Placements did not contain
documentation of a social service worker's face to face visit with the youth in the
youth's placement in the month of December.
IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
The facility was offered technical assistance in the following areas:
• Borrowed Beds - Be sure everything is entered/uploaded to the record timely
(prior to placement).
• Foster Home Reevaluations - Be specific when discussing the SOGIE family
is willing/not willing to accept. Include SOGIE specifications in
recommendation.
• Placement/Replacement documentation - The 3307 captures information
required to be provided to caregivers. When providing the 3307, be sure to
include all information.
V. CONSULTATION
The facility was offered consultation in the following areas:
• Borrowed Beds - Social Work contacts can be used to meet several of the
borrowed bed requirements.
• ICPC visits must meet required quality visit standards.
VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this licensing
period.
There were 2 incidents of substantiated corporal punishment during this licensing
period. The two special evaluations resulting in corporal punishment violations
reviewed were completed thoroughly and contained appropriate recommendations
based on the findings. No concerns were noted other than the one report
documenting the verbal summary was provided prior to the completion of the
investigation. An interview was conducted with the worker who completed that special
evaluation, and that worker reported the verbal summary documented was just a
preliminary discussion with the foster family about the likely findings. A final verbal

summary was provided at the conclusion of the investigation; however, that was not
accurately documented in CWLM.
Corrective Action Plan Compliance
The agency has submitted 1 acceptable corrective action plans (CAP) during this
licensing period, and compliance with each individual CAP is as follows: The one
CAP submitted by the agency during the period under review was submitted in
response to the 2/16/2024 interim licensing inspection report and was approved
on 3/7/2024. That CAP addressed eight violations, three of which were policy
violations no longer regulated by DCWL. The remaining five violations were rule
related. Compliance was achieved and maintained for four of those rules while the
remaining rule (initial medical examination timeliness) was repeated during the
current period under review. Eight rule violations were established this year that
were not established during the 2024 or 2023 licensing inspections.
Chief Administrator Assessment
The chief administrator report completed during the period under review indicated
barriers to compliance such as employee performance issues, worker turnover
resulting in half of the foster care team having less than one year experience, a
hiring pause resulting in low staffing, as well as staff medical leaves for periods
two months at minimum. The chief administrator indicated the prior year's CAP
was effective, overall, and resulted in improved compliance with initial/replacement
documentation, performance evaluations, and Family Team Meeting
documentation. Improvements in these areas were noted during this year's
inspection.
Financial Overview
N/A
Staff and Youth Interviews
The staff members interviewed reported receiving supportive supervision
throughout the year during which some workers left the agency and some were on
medical or parental leave. They reported receiving assistance from co-worker,
supervisors, the program manager, and the director with tasks and answers, as
needed. No concerns were reported.
Description of Agency Walk Through
The office appeared to have adequate space and equipment to provide for the
delivery of foster home certification, foster care, and independent living services.
Files are stored in a secured file room with locked cabinets containing closed
adoption files.
VII. FIELD ANALYST FINDINGS
No safety concerns identified.

VIII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the agency is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it
is recommended that the agency will be issued a renewal of their regular license.
March 7, 2025
_____________________________________
Holly Austin Date
Licensing Consultant
Approved By:
March 10, 2025

Jessica VandenHeuvel Date
Area Manager
